full_summary:
# **Archaeological Services – Tulita, NWT**

**Solicitation Number:** 5P420-24-0018/A
**Publication Date:** June 21, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** July 23, 2024, at 16:00:00

## **Background and Summary**

Parks Canada wishes to engage a professional archaeological consultant to conduct an archaeological impact assessment and mitigation work at Tulita, Northwest Territories. The selected consultant will carry out the work in compliance with the National Parks Regulations and relevant agreements.

## **Scope of Work**

The project involves conducting an archaeological impact assessment and mitigation measures in accordance with the requirements specified in the solicitation document.

## **Duration of Contract**

The contract is expected to commence on July 31, 2024, and will conclude on March 31, 2025, inclusive.

## **Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement**

The procurement is subject to the following comprehensive land claims agreements:

•	Sahtu Dene and Metis Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement (1994)

## **Security Requirement**

A security clearance is required for this project. New personnel security clearance requests must include fingerprinting for a mandatory criminal record check.

## **Procurement Method**

This is a request for proposal (RFP) procurement under a competitive, open bidding method.

## **How to Submit a Proposal**

Proposals must be submitted electronically to soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca. Only accepted email attachments will be considered. Late submissions will not be considered.

## **Bidders' Qualifications and Experience**

Bidders are expected to have extensive experience in providing archaeological services, including conducting impact assessments and mitigation measures. A detailed qualification statement highlighting relevant experience and personnel must be submitted with the proposal.

## **Procurement Documents**

All bids must be submitted using the specifications outlined in the solicitation document and attachments. Please note that the bidder is responsible for printing and collating the bid documents.

## **Enquiries**

Technical and contract-related enquiries must be submitted in writing, seven calendar days before the tender closing date.

## **Contact Information**

For any additional information or clarification, please contact Daniel Nguyen, daniel.nguyen@pc.gc.ca, at (403) 836-2352 or (1-866-246-6893).
